intro: Clidemia macrophylla, commonly known as broadleaf mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Clidemia macrophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
